page.title: 04ALL SAINTS CHURCH/INTERIOR
page.content: All Saints Church has three unique features.The first is the freize of small,bright memorial tiles extending all round the interior of the church.These tiles started in 1872 to commemorate men lost at sea.The second is the great marble memorial erected in 1779 in memory of Nicholas Magen. This is said to be the finest example of Italian marble in England.The third is found in the Beriffe Chapel:the famous fifteenth century Beriffe brasses. Other parts of particular interest are the 200 tapestry kneelers,each worked with a design reflecting the history of the community,some fine stained glass and the church chest made from a tree trunk.This dates back to 1740 and has three seperate locks so that it could only be opened by the vicar and two church wardens acting together.
